intro: Ardisia sadebeckiana, commonly known as the Sadebeck's evergreen. It is a species of flowering plant in the family Myaceae, native to the Philippines. The plant is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and produces small, white flowers followed by red berries. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
